I'm one of those people who constantly ward, and call for others to ward more. I'm a support main, typically have 10 - 20 more wards then the enemy team, even if they're completely destroying us...it's just too essential to NOT do. Two things in my eyes are key components towards having the best possible chance of winning, 1.) Vision control for map  awareness and understanding the enemy team's movements and priorities, and 2.) Team communication. Yes it sucks if you're being neglected in ANY lane, it's possible, even for bot to be continuously dove by 3, 4, 5 people, only to lose turret and dragon control, then when they rotate to top and mid the infamous "wow bot what are you doing, your laners are pushing mid and top, you know..the only two objectives left!' remarks. 

Fact of the matter is, Riot failed miserably with the warding and vision control changes. If you're behind, even if ONE teammate refuses to help with vision, it puts you at an almost insurmountable disadvantage. They failed, but that doesn't excuse you of not trying. Even if you're so far behind you're essentially cannon fodder, you can still at least be useful in this regard, communication and vision. 

When I top in ranked, keep in mind I'm absolute trash at anything but support, and have been working hard to try and become a useful laner, I go with the sole goal of not feeding...nothing more. I buy a pink, put it somewhere useful....tribush if it's available, or the bush next to tower and gromp if I'm on blue side or near baron bush. Then as soon as I'm level 9, I discard that worthless yellow trinket that only serves to bait most people into over extending into fog, and getting picked off. I get that blue trinket, and ANY time it's off CD I pop a ward down...somewhere it'd be useful...Along the 3 bushes in top lane, to prevent bush ganks, around our jungle, behind baron, etc. Before we as a team realize, I have 3 - 6 blue trinket wards down, and a pink, and that's how it goes every game. It's not impossible....and yes it's BEYOND helpful when the jungler helps, or other teammates...that's where communication comes in. It's a sad fact that teamwork won't always be possible, so it's best for you to depend on yourself...make it your goal to stay alive, and that's where warding comes in.

Hope your luck in games improve and you get more cooperative teammates, and find yourself enjoying the games more, until then...KEEP WARDING!

Correction: You should have been warding before they killed you enough times to be able to 2-man dive you without taking some sort of penalty in return.

You say that but really there's not that many ways for the enemy jungler to come at you. Provided your jungler isn't get stomped all over your own jungle is safe, and if you take into consideration how the enemy jungler usually paths to a gank (you need to ward further out for a shaco/nocturne, expect vi, kha, etc to try a wall hop) and keep track of where the jungler shows up so you know when he's been missing long enough to make it to top lane. If you think about that then knowing when and where to ward becomes rather simple, it might not be 100% but you should spot most ganks and be able to run away. It's also worth mentioning that your opposing laner will often give away a gank by acting aggressive for seemingly no reason...run. 

I mostly play mid lane where there's about a million paths to get ganked from but usually having 1 ward and cheating to that side of the lane is enough to escape 80% of ganks(provided I'm not overaggressing like an idiot).

No ward will save you from your 10th death but they might save you from your first or second death.

I really dont like the whole "classic bronze wanting to ward" excuse when it comes to warding. That just sounds to me like teammates that would rather blame others for dying so much rather than wanting to help.

It doesnt matter if you are Bronze or Challenger, you need wards. No it doesnt prevent you from dying but it DOES gives you the forethought to know whether or not you should stay in lane and continue to protect your tower or if you should back off. If there are multiple people missing on the map and you have an aggressive laner, chances are that their team is coming to help them push in the tower. If that is the case, you need to back off but only if you have the vision to back up that thought. Because either the missing mid could be going for blue buff with their jg, or the jg and 1 other player could be roaming to your lane to push tower in.

But you would only know that if you had vision around you far enough out to make that kind of decision.

If you're being pushed to turret keep a pink in tribush or the bush near gromp and you can see the enemy coming and will have enough time to GTFO

Its better to lose a turret than losing your life and the turret

In most cases when a top/jungler sees they can just dive you and keep you from getting levels they won't kill the tower. There's a very distinct advantage to having your solo laner 4+ levels higher than the other solo laner, so if you can keep hard pushing and just farm while they can't and while they die over and over when they get to lane it's best to do that.

Yeah, in an ideal world if you're behind you let them take the tower then freeze it and hope your team doesn't absolutely fall apart 4v5 while you catch up. But people take full advantage of how snowbally top is and will take you out of the game completely well before taking your tower.


for the edit:

You can't stand near the exp by the tower, if they just let minions push it down they deny you for a really long time.

Hell, sometimes you don't even feed a kill and are equal in CS and they just dive you anyway. Especially with something like malphite and kindred who are both ridiculously good at diving top lane.
